answers.author: Anna Read
answers.text:
The EPA Active Aging Awards are a great place to start looking for examples of communities that have worked to combine the principles of smart growth with active aging initiatives.  For more info on past award winners: http://www.epa.gov/aging/bhc/awards/2009/index.html.

answers.author: Evelina Moulder
answers.text:
ICMA, under the direction of the National Association of Area Agencies on Aging and in collaboration with several other partners, will be conducting a national survey on aging in the fall, which updates the survey conducted five years ago. The survey will identify communities that are supporting healthy aging.

author: Rebecca Hunter
text: Is your community changing the built environment or creating policies that will promote healthy aging?  The CDC Healthy Aging Research Network is gathering information about best practices and work in progress in this area.  We'd love to hear about your work!
title: Communities Making Environmental & Policy Change
